info.description: # Trader Make Money API Reference Welcome to the **Trader Make Money (TMM)** API. Our API allows you to programmatically access trade data, manage risk settings, and integrate your trading journal with external tools. --- ## 1. Access Points The API is accessible via a primary endpoint and mirrors for redundancy. | Environment | Base URL | | :------------ | :------------------------------------ | | **Main** | `https://tradermake.money/api/v2` | | **Mirror EU** | `https://tradermakemoney.com/api/v2` | | **Mirror RU** | `https://tradersmakemoney.com/api/v2` | --- ## 2. Authentication The TMM API supports two authentication methods. If both are provided, the **JWT Token** takes precedence. If the provided JWT is invalid, the request will return a `401 Unauthorized` error, even if a valid API Key is present. ### A. API Key Generated via the `PUT /api-user` endpoint. - **Header:** `API-KEY: ` **Example Request:** ```bash curl https://tradermake.money/api/v2/trades \\ -H "API-KEY: your_api_key_here" \\ -H "Content-Type: application/json" ``` ### B. JWT Token Obtained via `POST /auth/login`. Recommended for interactive applications. - **Header:** `Authorization: Bearer ` **Example Request:** ```bash curl https://tradermake.money/api/v2/trades \\ -H "Authorization: Bearer your_jwt_token_here" \\ -H "Content-Type: application/json" ``` **Automatic Token Refresh:** A new JWT token is returned in the response headers of every successful request. Update your stored token with the latest one to maintain an active session without manual refreshing. --- ## 3. Rate Limiting We enforce rate limits to ensure platform stability. Headers include: | Header | Description | | :---------------------- | :---------------------------------------------- | | `x-ratelimit-limit` | Max requests allowed in the current window. | | `x-ratelimit-remaining` | Requests remaining in the current window. | | `x-ratelimit-reset` | Unix timestamp (seconds) when the limit resets. | **Important:** Exceeding limits results in a `429 Too Many Requests` error. Persistent violations may lead to account or IP restrictions. --- ## OAuth2 Integration for Third-Party Services We provide OAuth2 support for partners and third-party developers who want to integrate TraderMakeMoney (TMM) directly into their platforms. This flow allows your users to securely link their TMM accounts to your service without manually copy-pasting API keys. ### Prerequisites - **Active Payment Plan:** OAuth2 connection creation is exclusively available to users with a paid plan. - **Free Account Restriction:** Requests initiated by users on a free plan will fail. - **Status Code:** `402 Payment Required` - **Response Body:** `{"error": "free account can't use oauth"}` ### 1. Registration To begin integration, please contact us at **info@tradermake.money** to obtain your `client_id` and a `private_key` for your service. ### 2. Authorization Flow You must implement a "Connect to TMM" button in your interface. This button should redirect users to the following authorization URL: ```text https://tradermake.money/app2/account/auth2/authorize/{client_id}?redirect_uri={your_redirect_uri}&response_type=code&client_id={client_id} ``` ### 3. Exchanging Code for a Permanent API Key Once the user authorizes the connection, TMM will redirect them back to your `redirect_uri` with a temporary `code`. You have **1 minute** to exchange this code for a permanent User API Key using the following endpoint: **POST** `/oauth2/token` **Headers:** - `API-KEY`: Your service's `private_key` (issued by TMM) - `Content-Type`: `application/json` **Request Body:** ```json { "code": "temporary_code_from_redirect", "client_id": "your_client_id" } ``` ### 4. Usage The response will contain a permanent **User API Key**. Once obtained, store this key securely. All subsequent requests to the TMM API on behalf of this user should use the standard **API-KEY** authentication header as described in the **Authentication** section. --- ## 4. Recent Changelog ### 2025 Updates - **Oct 29:** Added `PUT /api-key/batch` for bulk management. - **Sep 01:** Updated `GET /analyzer/` with `skipData` and `skipBalance` flags. - **Jul 24:** Added `income_percent_by_symbol` widget. - **Jul 18:** **API Key Migration**: Added `POST /api-key/{id}/migrate-to-new-id`. Reassigns all related data (trades, orders, etc.). (Admins only). - **Apr 22:** Added `websocket_status[]` multi-value filter for API keys (Enum `ApiKeyWebsocketStatus`). - **Apr 11:** Enhanced `/top` (Teams) endpoint. Now returns detailed user statistics (`pnl`, `percent`, `qty`) for today, yesterday, 7d, 14d, 30d, and custom periods. - **Apr 10:** Added `yesterday` and `14days` aggregation intervals for Teams. - **Apr 08:** `GET /trades/public-group/{code}` updated for cumulative income and win rate widgets. - **Apr 03:** **Risk Management Expansion**: Added support for fixed USD loss limits (`per_trade_usd`, `per_day_usd`). Updated Telegram/Discord notifications. - **Apr 01:** Updated Teams with custom 'from' and 'to' date support. - **Mar 25:** New Exchange Support: **Tiger X OKX** (Spot & Futures, IDs 44 & 45). - **Mar 19:** New Exchange Support: **Tiger X Binance** (Spot & Futures, IDs 42 & 43). - **Mar 18:** Fixed widget limits for free accounts on Public Profiles. - **Mar 03:** **OAuth2 & SSE**: Added OAuth2 support and SSE stream (`/user/oauth2`, `/oauth2/token`, `/oauth2/sse/{key}`). - **Feb 19:** New Exchange Support: **Bitget Spot** (ID 41). - **Feb 06:** Added `start_of_week` user setting (Monday/Sunday) for analytics. --- ## 5. Technical Remarks 1. **Timeframes:** All timestamps are in **milliseconds**. 2. **Performance:** Only the first 10 trades in a list include order data by default. Use `GET /trades/{trade_id}/orders` for the full list.
info.title: TMM API

get.description: Provides a detailed trading summary for a specific week, day, or month. Balance history is included for premium members. Use 'skipData' and 'skipBalance' parameters to exclude trade data or balance history for a faster response.
get.summary: Get Detailed Trading Analysis by Time Period

parameters.description: Pass true to skip trade data
parameters.name: skipData

parameters.description: Pass true to skip balance history
parameters.name: skipBalance

parameters.description:
string based params separated by ":"
"not:" - exclude trades with api key ids specified
parameters.name: api_key_id_params

parameters.description:
Trades by default have no category.
ID 1 is system category for archive trades. Excluded by default.
parameters.name: category

parameters.description:
string based params separated by ":"
"not:" - exclude trades with category ids specified
parameters.name: category_params

parameters.description:
Duration specified in milliseconds
Example: 1000,10000 - trades with duration between 1 and 10 seconds
parameters.name: durationBetween

parameters.description:
string based params separated by ":"
"not:" - exclude trades with tags specified
"all:" - all provided tags must be included/excluded
"only:" - trades with tags specified only
parameters.name: exit_tags_params

parameters.description: Headers are required only for CSV export method

"not:" - exclude trades with hours specified

parameters.description: Select only open or only closed trades.

"not:" - exclude trades with tags specified
"all:" - all provided tags must be included/excluded
"only:" - trades with tags specified only

parameters.description: Default value comes from user profile settings. By default is "open_time"
parameters.name: trade_time

parameters.description: Volumes (USD or native unitsâ€”match your backend), counts per window
parameters.name: volume1m

parameters.description: Turnover in USD - including all buy and sell orders value
parameters.name: volumeBetween

parameters.description: Volume spikes (ratio/z-score as you define), keep 1h24h included
parameters.name: volumeSpike1m30m

parameters.description:
By default archive trades are not included. If you want to include them,
set this to true. Or set category id to 1 (Archive ID).
parameters.name: with_archive

get.description: Fetches a list of all analyzer notes created by the user, with optional filtering by date range and note type.

post.description: Creates a new analyzer note or updates an existing one. If an ID is provided in the payload, the corresponding note will be updated; otherwise, a new note is created.
post.summary: Create or Update an Analyzer Note

get.description: Retrieves a trading summary aggregated by week or day. Balance history is only included for premium members.
get.summary: Retrieve Trading Summary by Time Period

post.description: Retrieves user-created drawings for a specific chart symbol.
Retrieves historical Kline data (candlesticks) for a specified ticker and interval. The response includes any user-created drawings on the chart.
post.summary: Get Kline Data for a Ticker

put.description: Adds a new API key to the user's account.

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of the current user's API keys.

put.description: Adds multiple API keys in a single batch request.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all API keys belonging to a specific user.

post.description: Updates an API key. If the public or secret key is changed, the connection to the exchange will be reloaded. Changing the exchange_id is not supported.

delete.description: Permanently deletes an API key and all associated trades and records.

post.description: Permanently disables an API key. A frozen key does not count towards the active connection limit. Free-tier users are limited to 3 frozen keys. This action is irreversible.
Manually triggers an update for the API key's funding information.
Clones an API key to a new ID, moving all associated trades and updating all relations. This administrative action ensures no data loss but may be time-consuming.
post.summary: Migrate API Key to New ID

post.description: Updates the name of an API key.
Initiates a download of the orders archive if it hasn't been downloaded previously. This is an admin-only action, is not supported by all exchanges, and can take a significant amount of time.
Resets and restores the API key's connection to the exchange.
Enables or disables the API key's connection to the exchange.
Enables or disables the extended list of tickers, exclusively for the Binance SPOT exchange. Enabling this feature may significantly increase connection time.
Manually triggers an update for the API key's balance information.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all API users associated with the current user.

post.description: Resends the account verification email if the previous link has expired or was not received.
Triggers a password reset process by sending an email with a unique recovery link to the specified address.
Authenticates a user and returns a JWT token for API communication. The token expires in 1 hour if not refreshed.
Logs the user out of the current session.

get.description: Fetches the complete profile for the authenticated user, including API keys, trading categories, custom tags, public profile status, and active integrations (Telegram/Discord/Risk Management).
Generates a new JWT token to replace an existing, unexpired one.

post.description: Creates a new user profile and returns an initial JWT authentication token. Users must verify their email via the link sent to their inbox to gain full access.
Finalizes the password recovery process. Requires a valid token received via email and the new password.

parameters.description: Recovery token and new password credentials
parameters.name: payload

post.description: Forcefully signs out the user from all connected devices and browsers by resetting the session security timestamp.

get.description: Validates the verification token sent via email. If requested via a browser (Accept: text/html), it redirects to the dashboard. If requested via API, it returns a JSON response. Link is valid for 1 hour.
Retrieves a list of user dashboards, including their associated widgets.

put.description: Creates a new, empty dashboard with a specified name. An error is returned if the user has reached their dashboard limit.

get.description: Returns the count of trades for a dashboard based on the supplied filters.

get.description: Loads an exported dashboard layout using a short URL code.

post.description: Installs a dashboard layout from a short URL code into the user's account.

get.description: Retrieves a list of dashboard layouts that the user has exported.
Loads all widgets for a public dashboard in bulk using a short URL code.
get.summary: Load Public Board Widgets in Bulk

post.description: Updates the display order of dashboards by providing an ordered list of their IDs.
Loads a widget for preview purposes without saving it.

put.description: Creates and attaches a new widget to a specified dashboard. An error is returned if the user has reached their widget limit.

post.description: Updates the properties of a widget.

delete.description: Deletes a widget from a dashboard.

post.description: Updates the properties of a dashboard.

delete.description: Deletes a dashboard and all of its associated widgets.

post.description: Creates a duplicate of an existing dashboard, including all of its widgets. An error is returned if the user has reached their limit for either dashboards or widgets.
Exports a dashboard's layout and returns a short URL for sharing.

get.description:
This endpoint streams data using "Transfer-Encoding: chunked", allowing asynchronous
loading of widgets in real-time.

Each chunk of data is a JSON object representing a widget's data or errors.
The chunks are separated by the custom delimiter "\x02\x03\x04END\x04\x03\x02".
Clients should accumulate the streamed data until this delimiter is encountered.
Once the delimiter is detected, the client can safely split the chunks, parse each
JSON object, and process the widget's data.

**Client-side logic**:
- Listen for data chunks from the server.
- Accumulate the response until the delimiter is detected.
- Split the response using the delimiter and process each JSON chunk individually.
- Handle potential parsing errors for incomplete or malformed JSON objects.

**Note**: The widgets are loaded asynchronously, so the client should wait for all
chunks to be received before assuming that all widget data is complete.

post.description: Generates a shareable short link for a dashboard.

get.description: Retrieves historical candlestick data for a given exchange, symbol, and time interval. Either a timeframe 'tf' or an 'interval' must be provided.
Retrieves a list of all Discord bot connections for the user.

put.description: Creates a new Discord bot connection.

post.description: Updates the settings for a Discord bot connection.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all exchanges available for connection.
Retrieves a combined list of tickers from all of the user's connected API keys.

post.description: Uploads one or more images and associates them with a specified model by owner type and ID.

delete.description: Deletes a file based on its owner type and ID.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all saved filter presets for the user.

post.description: Updates an existing filter preset.

get.description: Retrieves a comprehensive list of mentor groups, including those owned by the user, joined by the user, and public groups.
Retrieves a list of mentor groups that have accepted students.
Retrieves group details if the provided invite code is valid.

post.description: Marks all mentor notes for a specific trade as read. This action is available only to students.
Creates a note for a specific trade. This action is available only to mentors.
post.summary: Create Mentor Note for a Trade

get.description: Retrieves the details of a mentorship group. This action is available to the group owner only.

post.description: Updates the details of a mentorship group.
Allows a user to leave a mentorship group at any time.

put.description: Submits a request to join a mentorship group. An invite code is required for private groups. All requests are held in a pending state until approved or rejected by the group owner.

post.description: Allows a mentor or sub-mentor to accept or decline a student's request to join a group. The student will receive an email notification upon acceptance or rejection.

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of notification templates.

put.description: Creates a new notification template that can be used for any external notification service (e.g., Telegram, Discord).

post.description: Updates the name and description of a notification template.

get.description: Retrieves a list of the user's latest notifications, which can be marked as seen or interacted with.

post.description: Records a user's interaction with a notification.
Marks a notification as seen.

get.description:
Use the Stream for Server-Sent Events (SSE) to receive messages from the server.

Authorization must be provided through the Authorization header with a Bearer token or the API-KEY Header. Use a polyfill to modify the standard browser implementation if necessary.

## Events:

| Event ID             | Return Object      | Description                                                                         | Action Required                                  |
| -------------------- | ------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ |
| `trade`              | Trade              | Triggered only when a new trade is opened.                                          | None                                             |
| `trades`             | Empty              | Signals to update the trades list. Common after an API key connection.              | Update trades list                               |
| `profile`            | Empty              | Indicates a need to update user data.                                               | Update user data using `/auth/me`                |
| `transaction`        | Empty              | Signals that the list of transactions and their payment statuses should be updated. | Update list of transactions and payment statuses |
| `risk-management`    | RiskManagementLog  | Sent if a new risk management violation occurs.                                     | None                                             |
| `trade-update`       | Trade              | Sent after trade data is updated, including new executions on the exchange.         | None                                             |
| `notification`       | NotificationPublic | Indicates a new notification.                                                       | None                                             |
| `apikey`             | ApiKey             | Sent when the API key's status changes, e.g., from disconnected to connected.       | None                                             |
| `telegram-connected` | TelegramConnect    | Indicates a successful connection to Telegram.                                      | None                                             |
| `discord-connected`  | DiscordConnect     | Indicates a successful connection to Discord.                                       | None                                             |

post.description: Exchanges a 1-minute temporary OAuth2 token for a permanent User API Key. This request must be authenticated with the 3rd party's service API key.
post.summary: Exchange authorization code for API key

put.description: Creates a new risk management rule.

post.description: Updates an existing risk management rule.

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all risk management rules.

post.description: Backtests a risk management rule against historical trade data.

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all risk management violations recorded by the system.

post.description: Enables or disables a risk management rule.
Creates a new SSE stream on the server and returns a stream ID. This ID can then be used to receive messages from the server.
Removes an SSE stream from the server. For security, it is recommended to always disconnect after use.

get.description: Retrieves public statistics for the server.
Retrieves a list of 'hot' coins based on recent trading activity.

put.description: Creates a new, empty team. The owner is not required to be a member.

get.description: Retrieves team details by ID, including a count of active members. If called by the owner, it also returns the pending members count. For private teams, an invite code is required to access data. If the user has a pending join request, their membership status will be returned. A user can revoke their join request at any time.

post.description: Updates a team's name and description.

put.description: Creates a request to join a team. For private teams, an invite code is required, and the team owner must approve the request.

post.description: Allows a user to revoke a join request, or a team owner to accept or decline it. A revoked request cannot be altered by the team owner.

get.description: Retrieves a list of team members. For private teams, this is available only to the team owner, who can also use filters for searching. Revoked members are not visible, and by default, only active members are shown.

parameters.description: Default value is 2 (active). Nobody can see revoked members.
parameters.name: status

get.description: Retrieves the top-performing members of a team.
Retrieves a list of all Telegram bot connections for the user.

put.description: Creates a new Telegram bot connection.

post.description: Updates the settings for a Telegram bot connection.

parameters.description: Volume spikes (ratio/z-score as you define), keep 1h24h included
parameters.name: volumeSpike1m30m

parameters.description:
By default archive trades are not included. If you want to include them,
set this to true. Or set category id to 1 (Archive ID).
parameters.name: with_archive

post.description: Saves chart drawings that apply globally to a specific ticker.
post.summary: Save Global Chart Drawings for Ticker

post.description: Merges multiple trades into one. An error is returned if the trades do not have the same API key, symbol, and side.

get.description: Retrieves a group of public trades using a short URL hash.
get.summary: Get Public Trade Group by Short URL

get.description: Retrieves a public trade using its short URL hash.
get.summary: Get Public Trade by Short URL

post.description: Retrieves kline data for a public trade's chart using its short URL hash.

get.description: Generates a preview image for a trade. The preview is cached and will only be regenerated if the trade was updated more than 5 minutes ago.

post.description: Generates a shareable short link for a group of trades, respecting the user's public profile privacy settings. The same link will be returned for the same group of trades.
post.summary: Generate Short Link for Trade Group

get.description: Retrieves all tags that the user has created and applied to at least one trade.

post.description: Updates the tags for a selection of trades. An update for each trade will be sent through the SSE channel.
Updates the display order of tags by providing an ordered list of their IDs.
Updates the properties of a tag.

delete.description: Deletes a tag and removes it from all associated trades. âš ï¸ CAUTION: this action is irreversible. âš ï¸

post.description: Updates the category association for a collection of trades.
post.summary: Update trade category for multiple trades

post.description: Retrieves user-created drawings for a chart in an unparsed JSON format.
Closes a trade. This is applicable only to SPOT trades. If a trade has no sell orders, it will be moved to the archive category.
Retrieves kline data for a trade's chart with a selected interval. The response includes any user-created drawings on the chart.

get.description: Retrieves the list of orders associated with a specific trade.

post.description: Saves the drawings for a specific trade's chart.
Generates a shareable short link for a trade, respecting the user's public profile privacy settings. The same link will be returned for the same trade.

delete.description: Deletes a short link by its associated trade ID. No error is returned if the short link does not exist.

post.description: Updates the tags for a trade. Providing an empty list will remove all tags. A tag with an ID of zero will be newly created and attached.
Updates a trade's description, conclusion, and video link.
Cancels a transaction. The transaction must be in a pending state; otherwise, an error will be returned.

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of the user's transactions.

put.description: Creates a new transaction. Only one transaction can be active at a time. If a redirect URL is returned, the user must navigate to it to complete the transaction (e.g., for Stripe payments).

get.description: Retrieves information about any available discounts for the user.
Retrieves a list of pending transactions that have not yet been processed and can be canceled by the user.
Redirects the user to the Stripe billing portal. If the user is not subscribed, an empty string is returned.

put.description: Allows a user to apply for a 15-day trial, available once per account.

get.description: Retrieves UI data, which acts as a form of persistent local storage for the frontend.

put.description: Saves UI data, which acts as a form of persistent local storage for the frontend.

post.description: Generates a temporary authorization code for third-party integration. This code can be exchanged for an API key.

parameters.description: Client ID assigned to the 3rd party service
parameters.name: client_id

post.description: Redeems a promotional code to activate specific features, membership levels, or bonuses. Validates expiration and usage limits.

Updates account details for the authenticated user. If the email address is changed, the account status reverts to 'unverified' until the new address is confirmed. Returns an updated access token on success.
System-level endpoint to register multiple users and automatically create API keys for each.
Enables or disables the integration with CVizor services. Requires an existing CVizor account linked to the user.
Updates the user's primary email address. This action is only permitted if the account is not yet verified. Use this to correct typos during registration.

parameters.description: Credentials containing the new email address
parameters.name: payload

post.description: Saves the user's progress within the platform's onboarding guides or tutorials.
Updates the account's language setting for localized notifications, emails, and UI elements.

get.description: Fetches the settings and current state of the authenticated user's public profile.

post.description: Updates settings for the public profile. Note: Active participation in the global 'Top Traders' rankings requires a verified, enabled public profile.

get.description: Generates performance statistics for the current user's potential public profile. Works even if the profile is currently disabled.
Retrieves a trader's public profile information using their unique URL alias.
Retrieves detailed trading performance metrics for a public profile. Results can be filtered by specific durations.
get.summary: Fetch trading statistics for a public profile

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of shared trades for a specific public profile.
get.summary: List trades for a public profile

post.description: Changes the user's unique referral code. This code must be globally unique and follows specific formatting rules.
Persists the user's preference for Dark Mode (true) or Light Mode (false).

get.description: Returns a list of top-performing traders globally or within a specific league (e.g., Novice vs. Pro). Data is cached for 10 minutes.
Retrieves statistics regarding the user's referral network, including total referral count and aggregate earnings.

expires_at.description: Token valid until unix timestamp in seconds
Token valid until unix timestamp in seconds

text.example: mentor text note to the trade available to user

api_key_id_params.description:
string based params separated by ":"
"not:" - exclude trades with api key ids specified

category.description:
Trades by default have no category.
ID 1 is system category for archive trades. Excluded by default.

category_params.description:
string based params separated by ":"
"not:" - exclude trades with category ids specified

durationBetween.description:
Duration specified in milliseconds
Example: 1000,10000 - trades with duration between 1 and 10 seconds

exit_tags_params.description:
string based params separated by ":"
"not:" - exclude trades with tags specified
"all:" - all provided tags must be included/excluded
"only:" - trades with tags specified only

headers.description: Headers are required only for CSV export method

hours_of_day_params.description:
string based params separated by ":"
"not:" - exclude trades with hours specified

state.description: Select only open or only closed trades.

tags_params.description:
string based params separated by ":"
"not:" - exclude trades with tags specified
"all:" - all provided tags must be included/excluded
"only:" - trades with tags specified only

trade_time.description: Default value comes from user profile settings. By default is "open_time"

volume1m.description: Volumes (USD or native unitsâ€”match your backend), counts per window

volumeBetween.description: Turnover in USD - including all buy and sell orders value

volumeSpike1m30m.description: Volume spikes (ratio/z-score as you define), keep 1h24h included

with_archive.description:
By default archive trades are not included. If you want to include them,
set this to true. Or set category id to 1 (Archive ID).

color.description: [UI] Color in hex format (alpha is optional)

disabledCounter.description: [UI] to hide trades count on the chart

ma.description: [UI] Add moving average to the chart if possible

mini.description: [UI] now used only indirectly by calendar widget

private.description: Makes server return relative values. Safe to share with public.

websocket_status.description:
Websocket status
0 - disconnected
1 - connected
2 - connecting
3 - error

new_trade_notification.description:
Notification mode
0 - disabled
1 - all
2 - open only
3 - execution only

show_trades.description:
Show Trades:
0 - Disabled
1 - All
2 - Only Closed
3 - Only Opened

new_trade_notification.description:
Notification mode
0 - disabled
1 - all
2 - open only
3 - execution only

preview.description:
Preview mode (always disabled in private mode)
0 - disabled
1 - enabled for any notification
2 - enabled for close notification only

tags.description:
# Authorization

To communicate with api JWT token or Api-key required.

After sign-up, the user must confirm the account by clicking on the link sent to his email, otherwise all endpoints, except for `auth`, will return an error `429 Unauthorized`.
tags.name: auth
